website_summaries.verdict: This is a good choice if you're looking for a sound level meter on a budget, but it can be a little difficult to set up.
pros: Picks up sounds between 30 and 130 decibels with an accuracy within 1.5 decibels
Auto-off switch prevents accidental battery drain
cons: Users have said it is difficult to calibrate properly

customer_reviews.title: I like the feature that allows you to leave the device ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple. Works well. Unfortunately I have no way to calibrate it so I can only assume the readings are accurate. I like the feature that allows you to leave the device on (for hours) and it will record the lowest low or the highest high. I used it to prove my neighbor's son's truck fitted with aftermarket exhaust exceeds the city noise ordinance limits.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas F.

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap meter
customer_reviews.text: I used it to balance the outputs of my home theater speakers (which were well off by ear) and everything sounds more whole and present in the theater room. Reproducibility seems good, but I have no way to verify accuracy of the meter. For what I used it for, it is perfect. It may be nice to have one with an output jack if you want to get very serious about calibration, but for the price, it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Wilt

customer_reviews.title: As accurate as the high cost models
customer_reviews.text: Used this to help neighbors get next door industrial fans moved. Family took readings at 6 am -when fans cut on- at bedroom, louder than a vacuum cleaner! Gave readings to attorney who called company and company switched sides of building the fans operated from. Noise and chems were affecting them and their dog! May have been blowing out toxic air. Fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Masterprof

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it will do. It is ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says it will do. It is a little off of my other readers and I wish it had the ability to recall and see the high/low levels reached. It is only a real time sound level meter, that's it, dont expect more. Gave it an extra star as customer service read my review and reached out to me to see if they could help. They were very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Wadev3

customer_reviews.title: Works great for ensuring a hearing safe environment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my new Suppressed AR in 300 Blackout. I wanted to ensure that it was hearing safe, just to be sure, even though I was pretty certain that it would be. I found out that my rifle is a whisper quiet 108 decibels (@ 1m distance) directly perpendicular to the ejection port. It's roughly 120 decibels at my ear, which is within the range of hearing safe for impulse noises, which in general is considered hearing safe if it is below 130 decibels. It's also fun to play around with around the house, so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: The Taylors

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to use!
customer_reviews.text: Generally quite convenient to use in various applications, such as for measuring loudness in church services, along public roadways, theme parks, various events (ball games, movies, thunderstorms, etc.); however, I miss having a slow response setting for obtaining average figures of loudness; also a choice of A weighing , C weighing and no weighing.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: The refresh rate is horribly slow, never gives a accurate reading
customer_reviews.text: The refresh rate is horribly slow, never gives a accurate reading, it fluctuated from 110 db to 80 db in a nightclub where I know it was above 90 the whole time. Also make sure you notice that it is striclya weighted
customer_reviews.author: ian c.

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome! I love putting it close to things that ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I love putting it close to things that make sound. I even involved my kids and had them play with it. My husband has taken over this product and brought it to work to check the noise levels of the heavy machinery that he deals with. I has been please with it. Would be great for those that need to check noise levels, my husband was very happy with the product and found it very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Faye Bell

customer_reviews.title: What is too loud?
customer_reviews.text: My tinnitus gets worse every now and then so I bought this to help me track down the cause. Each exposure to excessive noise increases the ringing in my ears. When William Shatner first got tinnitus he considered suicide.
customer_reviews.author: USA

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any prior experience with these devices but this one seems pretty good for the value. The numbers seem pretty bouncy but you can get a good idea of what's a dangerous volume and what's not. I use this for when I want to know if notice is around 85+db. I assume it's not the most accurate product but it works for what I use it for. Over satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The product worked very well However the broken seal on the package and the dead battery it came with, led me to believe it may have been a used one that was returned and repackaged.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchased this meter
customer_reviews.text: It broke within 5 minutes of being at a High School basketball game to measure noise levels. Readout read 29.5 decibels and would not get off that number. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: John Martin

customer_reviews.title: Learn danger levels first.
customer_reviews.text: Like radiaton, noise levels can be harmful to health. I test frequently within my home.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Richards

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Does not work. Even in a silent room the numbers are jumping. It has never worked. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Stringer

customer_reviews.title: It's not a bad machine and costs almost nothing
customer_reviews.text: Not all the features I want but the machine does what is promises to do. It's a little awkard to use and to this day, after 100's of uses I still can't tell if it's accurate or if the info is just junk. After all that. It's not a bad machine and costs almost nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It works well and is good enough for what I am using it for
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to know how loud it was at a night club and it was too loud for my hearing. It works well and is good enough for what I am using it for. Good choice.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good for a cheap sound level meter for louder sounds
customer_reviews.text: Works at least as well as my smartphone with sound level measurement app. I'm not overly confident that the calibration of this device is adequate at lower sound levels such as a quiet living room. But it's cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Use a cellphone app instead
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't complain much, though. That's why I gave it 3 stars instead of 1. You get what you pay for. The max button is almost unusable, the moment you press the button, it logs 50-60dB because of vibration from the touch itself. Reading is not as sensitive / accurate as my iphone app. I suppose iphone has better microphones.
customer_reviews.author: richard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We don't know if it's already calibrated or if we need to do that ourselves, but assumed it was calibrated at some point prior to shipping. It's been effective thus far and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: jobobz

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty inaccurate on the low scale. 61 dba in a room with nothing making noise is pretty unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Times out and turns off (10-min) sooner than I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: prag

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have many features or anything, but you can't get any more for the the price. It's much lower than most, and it works well. The backlight is helpful in dark places, like live events and what not. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Mine sounds like I'm in a RR station when I'm on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see how loud my car is compared to a new car. Mine sounds like I'm in a RR station when I'm on the phone. Newer cars are quieter. This is helping me decide what car to get next.
customer_reviews.author: Redhairgal

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my purpose which was to measure sound reduction ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my purpose which was to measure sound reduction of a quiet box for a generator that I built.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: Easy open and easier use. It even comes with batteries! It's so cool. Perfect handheld meter.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Compact...
customer_reviews.text: I have no way to really check its accuracy but it seems great.
customer_reviews.author: DKT

customer_reviews.title: It is probably good as could be for price I paid
customer_reviews.text: It is probably good as could be for price I paid. It does not keep history for each event which is what I needed. EJ
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: This handy unit got my neighbor, a machine shop in proximity, to quiet down once I told them the Db at the fence (through my local PD).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect item for acoustical treatment to a room. A very good way to find reflection points.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rushford

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good service
customer_reviews.text: Good product and good service. Wish there were fuller instructions but so be it. A terrific buy for the money.
customer_reviews.author: adsmlt39

customer_reviews.title: Problem is calibration. Impossible to do accurately without a ...
customer_reviews.text: Problem is calibration. Impossible to do accurately without a $1000 or so SPL standard.
customer_reviews.author: Karl  Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Works really well and the price is good. It might help me remember to keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well and the price is good. It might help me remember to keep the volume down and save my hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Torg 1

customer_reviews.title: electronic engineer to figure out!
customer_reviews.text: I have not figured out how to program the thing; it's not at all easy to figure out as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Homeengineer

customer_reviews.title: Not Precise, Good For General Purposes Only
customer_reviews.text: I used GoldWave to create audio files for each frequency on my EQ and attempted to use this meter to set the levels. This device was way off. With each frequency file being an exact and constant volume level, this meter should have registered a precise level on each sound file, but it was co stantly going g up and down by more than 10db. The higher the frequency, the more erratic the meter was. You can use this meter to get an idea of the volume of your surroundings (the min/max feature will help with that), but you're not going to be able to use it to equalize your stereo system with any level of precision.
customer_reviews.author: VG Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: This Decibel Meter is a great addition to my testing equipment that includes non contact ...
customer_reviews.text: This Decibel Meter is a great addition to my testing equipment that includes non contact temperature and DS meter. I am going to use it to evaluate the soundproofing of both doors and windows.
customer_reviews.author: stephen pouliot

customer_reviews.title: Dud
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work but the second time I went to use it and power it on it just shut off after 2 seconds. Tried it multiple times and even changed the battery with a brand new one but it just wouldn't stay powered on.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: set up studio monitors
customer_reviews.text: great for helping set up studio monitors and many other audio needs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Take it on your next test drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this to establish the noise level in my cars and trucks.
customer_reviews.author: SimonB

customer_reviews.title: Great hobby meter!
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive meter, works well, very good price, great for hobby (non-professional) use.
customer_reviews.author: TimS

customer_reviews.title: Sound meter was defective and failed to display digital reading ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound meter was defective and failed to display digital reading after about an hour of use. Meter was returned with note for reason of return and credit was requested. Credit was received.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Lenertz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: easy to use compared to others i have worked with
customer_reviews.author: T. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. Had lots of fun testing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: SHOULD HAVE READ THE DESCRIPTION BETTER.
customer_reviews.text: WISHED IT HAD A HIGHER RANGE, SHOULD HAVE READ THE DESCRIPTION BETTER.
customer_reviews.author: VIP AUTO NYC, STATEN ISLAND NEW YORK 10302

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was helpful in measuring noise from inside my house
customer_reviews.author: Winklemeijer

customer_reviews.title: Good device, great value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to measure some appliances around the house. It's great! Runs on 3 AAA batteries that are included. There's a foam piece to help in windy situations. Usage is super simple. Just 3 buttons. There's the on/on with back light/off button. Then there's a min/max button, and a hold button. I find the measurements reliable and repeatable. At under $20 you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: YouMaybeRightIMaybeCrzy

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Sound Meter
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use sound meter offered at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Despite the accuracy this is a great product with great human interface and design.
customer_reviews.author: Johann Lollipop

customer_reviews.title: Nice Sound Meter
customer_reviews.text: Used it to show how my neighbors car was being too loud per city ordinance. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would like an adjustable response time so I could obtain average ...
customer_reviews.text: The unit works well. I would like an adjustable response time so I could obtain average readings instead of rapidly changing values while someone speaks.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Giesler

customer_reviews.title: Good product value and great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I had some questions relating to the instruction manual describing how to calibrate the meter. MC-POWER has assured me that their GoerTek Sound Decibel Meter is accurate without need to calibrate it straight out of the box. I was most impressed with their concern over customer satisfaction to have responded so quickly. The sound level meter works quite well and I think it has great value.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great help!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect equipment to help me get through a major national event
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right dfor the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted to hear (see) how loud my High Power air rifles were,it works great i think,that maybe because NASA wont lend me the meter they use,so I dont have a KNOW accurate meter to test this against,All kidding aside,this is a great way to find out just how loud things are in our world,you may be surprised.
customer_reviews.author: niteliter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, consistent readings
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for me and I received consistent readings. I wanted to measure the loudness of propane burnishers and see not only how they compared to each other but also how much louder they would become in a smaller room. My readings in the 85 db to 100 db range were consistent and helpful for the business.
customer_reviews.author: Waxman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it yet but like how it works. Simple instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: noise like a bowling alley
customer_reviews.text: this is a WORTHLESS TOY. Held up to ceiling being used as a romper room, noise like a bowling alley, did not even register any change or any of the base loud noises at all. worthless toy. waste of 14.00. complete waste. You could tap-dance next to it & it wouldn't know the difference. Just reads 45 to 58-59 even in complete silence when breathing but then no change when there is noise.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had one years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and helpful from venue to venue.
customer_reviews.author: Simply Real

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a good price. Requires AAA batteries instead of 9volt which is a plus for me.
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done, seems reasonably accurate. You can't beat the price. The thing that I found particularly compelling about this model was that it required AAA batteries instead of the 9volt which can get expensive quickly.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Fun to Play With
customer_reviews.text: I have a bum ear so I can't really tell how loud something actually is. I got this on a whim just to play with. Works perfectly to monitor sound. Fun to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Insane Diego

customer_reviews.title: Received a dirty, USED item with missing components instead of a new item!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the product I received. The product is obviously USED since the case has scuff marks and appears to be dirty. The product was supposed to include 3, AAA batteries. When I opened the battery compartment, there was one AAA battery already installed and no other batteries were included. The user manual was not in the package. I think this is a good product for the price, but I ordered a NEW product and I received a dirty, USED item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: can not contact manufacturer, the manual is inadequate, it is basically useless without the necessary info.
customer_reviews.author: amir seghatoleslami

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work ok.
customer_reviews.text: So far it works. I can't speak to how accurate it is however, as I have nothing to compare to.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita

product_meta.title: Sound Decibel Meter, GoerTek Digital Mini Sound Pressure Level Meter, Audio Noise Measurement 30-130dBA,MAX/MIN Hold,Auto Backlight Display-3AAA Battery Includedd (GM1352)
feature_bullets: Records Max/Min values over time ; Fast Responding .
Measures in dBA Frequency ; Frequency Response: 31.5Hz~8.5KHz.
Auto Power Off or Manual Shut Off by Pressing the Power Button for Two Seconds.
